text:
Parades, Celebrations and Municipal Events: A southward view on Broadway from a point to the north of Prince Street and across same, showing what the writer believes to be the funeral procession of Gen. U.S. Grant, marching northward to the temporary tomb in Riverside Park. Leading to this conclusion is the fact that August, Bernheim, Bauer & Co. occupied No. 516 Broadway between 1882 and 1886 and subsequently became Bernheim, Bauer & Co. in 1888, occupying quarters at 507-9-11 Broadway (opposite side of this thoroughfare).

An account of this funeral appears in Harpers Magazine of October 1885 (Vol. LXXI) on page 806; and the Independent of August 6, 1885 (Vol. 37) on page 15.

August 8, 1885.
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Funeral procession: U. S. Grant.

text:
Celebrations, Parades and Municipal Events: The General U. S. Grant funeral procession passing Prince Street on Broadway. The photographer's direction is southward down the latter thoroughfare and shows building fronts on the east side of same.

August 8, 1885

Gift of Urbrock Collection
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - U. S. Grant's Funeral.

text:
594-596 Broadway, east side, between Prince and East Houston Streets.

About 1920.

Edwin Levick,
Gift of E.M. Jenks.

Prince Street, west from and including Broadway.
April 29, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
